HudWindow

A class, which can create browser overlays in the DOM without needing remote content.  The HudWindow is best used for tasks which are unique to the extension and do not require custom styling.

Deprecation warning This class will eventually be removed as it has been decided that overlays should always be returned from the pmog server.  This keeps the extension much more generic and less brittle.

Parameters

bodyThe window’s content (can be HTML)
tyypeString specifying the window’s type
idUnique identifier used by the Display class to control the window.
Summary
HudWindow
A class, which can create browser overlays in the DOM without needing remote content.
Functions
HudWindow
Initializes the Object
show_in_queue
Hud windows are not shown in queues so always return false.
init
Initializes the object
tag_form_html
Deprecation Warning Generates the code needed to display the tag form within the browser
instant_message_player_form_html
Deprecation Warning Generates the code needed to display the instant messenger form within the browser
mission_log_form_html
Deprecation Warning Generates the code needed to display the mission log within the browser.
portal_form_html
Deprecation Warning Generates the code needed to display the portal form within the browser.
add_drag_handle
Including this function within a HudWindow will make a portion of the HudWindow draggable.

portal_form_html

HudWindow.prototype.portal_form_html = function(id)

Deprecation Warning Generates the code needed to display the portal form within the browser.

Note that we use + (new Date().getSeconds()) at the end of the text fields because otherwise the JS won’t check to see if the values of the fields have actually changed.  This may be a bug in the setAttribute function or the way that firefox handles forms.  We strip this off once the form has been picked up by the mailman.

Parameters

idUnique identifier used by the Display class to control the window.

add_drag_handle

HudWindow.prototype.add_drag_handle = function()

Including this function within a HudWindow will make a portion of the HudWindow draggable.

HudWindow.prototype.add_drag_handle = function()
Including this function within a HudWindow will make a portion of the HudWindow draggable.
Used by the extension to handle the rendering of overlays and events to the browser viewport.
This class stores all the attributes needed by the player during the normal course of play.
